definition: to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: The songs on this album became popular hits and were broadcast on television and radio station throughout Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 專輯歌曲如此暢銷，阿富汗全國電視電臺紛紛播送。

sentences.english: Pipe down , children. I'm trying to listen to the news on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 靜一靜，孩子們，我想聽無線電裏播送的新聞。

sentences.english: The performance is broadcast on high-fidelity speakers and high-definition television.
sentences.chinese: 表演在高保真度揚聲器和高清晰度電視上播送。

sentences.english: We beamed the program to the countries of Central America.
sentences.chinese: 我們向中美洲國家播送節目。

sentences.english: Already, whole pop concerts have been sent over the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 已經有整臺整臺的流行音樂會在國際互聯網上播送。

sentences.english: In this thesis, we focus on unicast service connections only.
sentences.chinese: 在本論文中，我們只考慮單一播送的連線服務。

sentences.english: The television station broadcasts over a wide compass.
sentences.chinese: 電視臺播送節目的範圍很廣。

sentences.english: The network blacked out the New York City area.
sentences.chinese: 電視網不向紐約市地區播送這類電視節目。

sentences.english: The broadcast advertising model is not relevant to the narrowcast nature of the Web.
sentences.chinese: 廣播廣告模式和網絡定向播送的實質並沒有多大聯繫。

sentences.english: This is Radio Two. Here is the one o'clock news.
sentences.chinese: 第二套電臺節目開始廣播，現在播送一小時新聞。

sentences.english: The news wismost the extended width is send out to another country.
sentences.chinese: 寬度加寬的音塵被播送到國外。

sentences.english: Radio and television programmes have also fooled many people by broadcasting reports which are untrue.
sentences.chinese: 廣播和電視節目通過播送不實報道也耍了很多人。

sentences.english: Within seconds of going on the air, London Weekend Television was blacked out.
sentences.chinese: 倫敦週末電視節目播送了幾秒鐘就停播了。

sentences.english: The radio is broadcasting the latest news about the man-made satellite.
sentences.chinese: 電臺正在播送有關人造衛星的最新消息。

sentences.english: We broadcast the news to the local population every morning.
sentences.chinese: 我們每天上午向當地居民播送新聞。

sentences.english: Now Radio Beijing presents Music from China.
sentences.chinese: 現在北京電臺開始播送“中國音樂”。

definition: broadcast/CL:個|个[ge4]/broadcasting/to broadcast/(formal) to propagate/to publicize
to broadcast over a network/(radio or TV) hookup/simulcast
to interrupt (a radio or TV program) with a commercial insert, breaking news etc/to put a call on hold
